At line 6795, `.calendar-date.today` has `border: 2px solid #f57c00 !important;`. This rule applies to all cells with `.today`, not just Today. In `calendarShared.js` (lines 264–266), `.today` is added only for today. So all cells receiving `.today` are only Today’s cells.

Initialization looks correct. The handler uses `messagesContainer.addEventListener('mousemove', mousemoveHandler)` on the container. The image shows a scrollbar and truncated content, so scrolling works but is sluggish. Checking scroll speed (currently `deltaY * 2`):

Scroll rate is `deltaY * 2`. The handler stops events from propagating to the background but doesn’t start modal-level scrolling. Other modals (calendar, booking) suppress middle mouse. Checking if the AI chat modal requires the same; the message handler alone is too limited. Adding a top-level handler:


---

Middle mouse scrolling is tied to the messages container; `mousemoveHandler` is only attached there (line 637), so it won’t scroll if you press on a bubble. Attaching a handler on the popup and forwarding to the container:


---
